contentrichtext.text: '''Lachmann''' (also '''Lachman''' or '''Lachemann''') is a family name of [[Germany|German]] origin and may refer to: == Lachmann == * [[Erich Lachmann]], Nazi SS officer at Sobibor extermination camp * [[La Païva|Esther Lachmann]], later Pauline Thérèse Lachmann, later Mme Villoing,, later Mme la Marquise de Païva, later [[Countess Henckel von Donnersmarck]], [[courtesan]] * [[Gustav Lachmann]], engineer * [[Hans Lachmann-Mosse]], publisher * [[Karl Lachmann]], classic philologist, Germanist * [[Ludwig Lachmann]], Austrian economist * [[Peter Lachmann]], British immunologist and nephew of Robert Lachmann * [[Robert Lachmann]], German ethnomusicologist and musicologist == Lachman == * [[Zvi Lachman ]] * [[Dichen Lachman]] * [[Harry Lachman]] * [[Irwin Lachman]] * [[Patrick Lachman]] * [[Lachman test]] (Lachman maneuver) == Lachemann == * [[Marcel Lachemann]] * [[Rene Lachemann]] {{surname}} [[Category:Surnames]]
